definition[0]: to be present at a meeting but not take an active part in it
example[0]: Would you like to sit in on some of my interviews?
definition[1]: a type of protest in which people refuse to leave the place where they work or study until their demands are considered or agreed to
example[1]: Several thousand students staged sit-ins and protest marches.
definition[2]: a type of protest in which people refuse to leave the place where they work or study until their demands are agreed to
example[2]: Several hundred employees of a national bank staged a sit-in to protest against plans to close branches and cut jobs.
